section.para: Get value function to get buffers for iv_value for the specified iv_key.
Callback implementation is expected to provide buffers inside of iv_value parameter with sufficient space to store value for the specified iv_key.

If iv_value == NULL, then it means the caller does not need the buffer, but in this callback, it should still check if it can access the IV value by permission flag(crt_iv_perm_t), and setup the cache entry if necessary.
When called with CRT_IV_PERM_READ permission, it will fetch the IV value, i.e. the following callback will be iv_on_fetch(), and also returned iv_value will only be used for reading data out of it.

When called with CRT_IV_PERM_WRITE permission, it will update the IV value, i.e. the following callback will be iv_on_update() etc, and also returned iv_value will be used by framework for storage of intermediate values.
Callback implementation should consider iv_value being 'in use' until a corresponding crt_iv_on_put_cb_t callback is called.
